oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Axially Chiral Imidodiphosphoric Acid Catalyst for Asymmetric Sulfoxidation Reaction: Insights on Asymmetric Induction**
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JINDAL, G
SUNOJ, RB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: asymmetric catalysis
BrOnsted acids
density functional calculations
noncovalent interactions
transition states
CONFINED BRONSTED ACIDS
HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE
C-H
CHEMOSELECTIVE OXIDATION
NONCOVALENT INTERACTIONS
MECHANISTIC INSIGHTS

ALDOL REACTIONS
LIGANDS
ACTIVATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Insights into chiral induction for an asymmetric sulfoxidation reaction involving a single oxygen atom transfer are gained through analyzing the stereocontrolling transition states. The fitting of the substrate into the chiral cavity of a new class of imidodiphosphoric BrOnsted acids, as well as weak CH and CHO noncovalent interactions, are identified as responsible for the observed chiral induction.
